abstract: Japanese Emperor Akihito delivers speech expressing 'deep remorse' for nation's part in World War II during memorial service for 70th anniversary of conflict's end; language raises speculation that Akihito was indirectly criticizing Prime Min Shinzo Abe, who has moved to loosen postwar restrictions on Japanese military.
lead_paragraph: Emperor Akihito, whose father announced his exhausted country’s surrender in World War II 70 years ago, expressed “deep remorse” for the conflict on Saturday at a memorial service marking the anniversary of the war’s end.

headline.main: Emperor Akihito Expresses ‘Deep Remorse’ for Japan’s Role in World War II
headline.print_headline: Japan’s Emperor Expresses ‘Deep Remorse’ for War
